abstract: The decision by a Washington regulator casts doubt on a merger that would create the country’s biggest utility operator.
snippet: The decision by a Washington regulator casts doubt on a merger that would create the country’s biggest utility operator.
lead_paragraph: Before Tuesday, Exelon seemed close to sealing its $6.8 billion takeover of a fellow utility operator, Pepco Holdings, having secured support from most of the power regulators it needed to satisfy.

headline.main: Regulator Votes to Block Merger of Pepco and Exelon
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Washington Regulator Blocks Exelon-Pepco Utility Merger

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
